unnormalised: Organic farming in India holds immense potential. Studies by ICAR-NRRI, Cuttack, indicate improved soil health. Traditional practices, like those used in Kerala during Onam, emphasize natural inputs. However, yields can be a concern for farmers in states like Bihar. Further research is needed to optimize organic methods for crops like basmati rice in Punjab & improve farmer income beyond Rs. 2 Lakh/year.
